definition: oriental cherry (Prunus serrulata or Prunus yedoensis), prized for its blossom/also known as sakura (Japanese) or Yoshino cherry
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: The Formosan landlocked salmon is the only salmon to live in a subtropical region.
sentences.chinese: 臺灣的櫻花鉤吻鮭是唯一生活在亞熱帶的鮭魚。

sentences.english: Sakura Shopping Center is a good place to go shopping.
sentences.chinese: 櫻花購物中心是個購物的好地方。

sentences.english: But this year, the Cherry Blossom Festival is very, very special.
sentences.chinese: 但今年的櫻花節是尤其的非常的特別。

sentences.english: The beauty of cherry flowers and military arts give rise to the aesthetics view of Japanese people.

sentences.english: I adjusted the shade so the lamp would shine its light out the window onto the cherry blossoms, turning them almost white.
sentences.chinese: 被我折了方向的燈翼，光源投往窗外照白半樹枝櫻花。

sentences.english: As the decline of its character, like cherry blossoms in Japan, and belong to a very bad Sheng.
sentences.chinese: 它的衰落如同日本的櫻花性格一樣，屬於盛極而衰。

sentences.english: Every April, the Japanese celebrate Cherry Blossoms Festival.
sentences.chinese: 每年四月，日本人慶祝櫻花節。

sentences.english: If you go there in spring, you are sure to see the beautiful flowers-cherry blossom.
sentences.chinese: 如果你春天去日本，你肯定會看到那些美麗的櫻花。

sentences.english: The Four Seas Xianting fly short Zhao, the Shenzhou held fire cherry Xie.

sentences.english: Park, a beautiful cherry tree, sat a pair of men and women as soon as the United States.

sentences.english: That was the biggest cherry blossom festival in china.
sentences.chinese: 這也是國內最大的櫻花節。

sentences.english: Our blend features Silver Needle, highest quality white tea, with Sakura.
sentences.chinese: 我們混合了功能銀針，最優質的白茶與櫻花。

sentences.english: They just want to take a beautiful photo under the trees of cherry blossom.
sentences.chinese: 他們只是想在櫻花樹下拍張好看的照片。

sentences.english: Here we see the cherry stock ready to accept the maple and walnut inlays.

definition: to bloom/to blossom/to flower/fig. to burst open/to feel happy or elated/new development grows out
land used for growing plants/site used for public recreation/abbr. for a place ending in 園|园, such as a botanical garden 植物園|植物园, kindergarten 幼兒園|幼儿园 etc
